dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So, a nuclear submarine in the Caspian Sea—real or just another rusty old shipwreck?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It does, but Konarbay Bazarbayev from the fisheries inspection department is saying it's absolutely not a submarine. He called it part of an old vessel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And he's like, one hundred percent sure? That's pretty definitive. He says they patrol the area regularly and see this kind of thing all the time.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "100 percent not a submarine. We regularly patrol the northern Caspian and come across many old ship fragments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He mentioned the sea level's dropping, so stuff that used to be deeper—like, 5 to 7 meters down—is now visible in just 3 meters of water.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He mentioned the sea level's dropping, so stuff that used to be deeper-like, five to seven meters down-is now visible in just three meters of water.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the sea level drops, wreckage that was previously submerged at depths of 5-7 meters is now visible in waters as shallow as 3 meters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so it's not some secret military thing, it's just… climate change revealing old wrecks?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so it's not some secret military thing, it's just... climate change revealing old wrecks?

dialogue_turns.text: Basically. And this isn't even the first time—Lada.kz reported on another "ghost ship" situation before.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Local media note that this is not the first time such claims have surfaced. Lada.kz previously reported on another wreck in the Caspian, which was dubbed a "ghost ship" by social media users due to its eerie appearance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, social media loves a spooky story. Remember that military flask someone found in Mangystau? People get excited.
